function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate ventilation in office environments increases the risk of airborne virus transmission due to the presence of micro respiratory droplets.","Impact":"Potential spread of contagious diseases within the office environment, leading to increased illness and absenteeism.","Mitigation":"Increase outdoor airflow rates, utilize air cleaners and filters, and maintain healthy temperature and relative humidity levels to minimize the spread of airborne viruses.","Technologies":"HVAC systems with minimum outdoor airflow rates, MERV 13 or better air filters, air cleaners.","People":"Employees working in the office environment.","Owner":"Facility managers, building owners, and office administrators."},{"Description":"Office buildings were not designed with sufficient consideration for infectious disease control, leading to an increased risk of viral spread within the workplace.","Impact":"Lack of infectious disease control features in building design increases the vulnerability of office workers to contagious diseases and reduces workplace productivity.","Mitigation":"Redesign office buildings to incorporate infectious disease control features, such as improved ventilation, air filtration, and layout modifications to reduce crowding.","Technologies":"Building design software, HVAC systems, air filtration systems.","People":"Designers, architects, building planners, and construction stakeholders.","Owner":"Building owners, developers, and property management companies."},{"Description":"Employee preference for lower-levelled office buildings with sprawling staircases over tall and crowded buildings due to fear of virus infection.","Impact":"Decreased demand for tall and crowded office buildings, leading to potential financial losses for building owners and developers.","Mitigation":"Redesign tall buildings to incorporate infection control features, improve elevator and stairwell systems, and communicate the implementation of safety measures to alleviate employee concerns.","Technologies":"Building design software, elevator and stairwell monitoring systems, communication platforms.","People":"Building owners, developers, and employees.","Owner":"Building owners, developers, and property management companies."}]}
